title: Computer-Assisted Mathematics Lesson Design for Students with Learning and Behavioral Disabilities in Large-Scale Education

context.prior_knowledge: Basic mathematical computation skills and fundamental digital device usage abilities
context.additional_context: Need for customized CAI (Computer-Assisted Instruction) programs considering learning and behavioral disabilities, including analysis of animation's impact on learning outcomes and motivation

learning_goals: Learners can solve fraction operation problems with over 80% accuracy through the CAI program
Learners can apply error correction strategies three or more times using feedback provided within the CAI program
Learners can visualize mathematical concepts in two or more ways using animated elements of the CAI program
Learners can maintain at least 75% learning engagement by consistently participating for over 150 minutes per week when using the CAI program

resources: BYOD-Compatible Mathematics CAI (Computer-Assisted Instruction) Programs (3 Types)
LMS system for tracking learning progress

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
